data.message: Though they cleaned up the dirty bits, its still a little weird hearing such a raunchy song in such a family friendly movie trailer.

replies.message: Family friendly my ass! How much attention have you paid to Despicable Me? Its as bad as Spongebob lmao granted their jokes aren't easily understood from a child's perspective but still...our children arent that oblivious
I haven't really seen the movies. I was just going by the movie trailer which is why I said 'family friendly movie trailer.'
They also used What's the Difference from The Chronic 2001, lol, which by the way also features Eminem.
Lmao okay but def not suitable for children of a certain age. Dont want to encourage certain behaviours lol
Despicable Me is far from family friendly at times, lol.

Kids arent going to watch it a grow up bad...that takes more than a damn movie.. 😒..is it hallmark film no..but its not inappropriate for kids...fuck kids learn more from parents than a damn movie can ever teach them
I thought the same. I lovr this song but it is so rude for a kids movie haha..

It's just in the trailee I think. In the movie I guess, It will pop up in end credits.
Even if it's featured in the movie somewhere, They will obviously call out the bad words. Just like they did in this trailer.
